title.narrative: Conservation of Submerged 17th-Century Cultural Objects from Rockley Bay at Scarborough Harbour

description.narrative: The submerged cultural objects in Rockley Bay are what remain from a fierce 17th-century naval battle between the British and Dutch for control of the strategically important island of Tobago. This project involves the conservation of recovered objects and training opportunities for university students.

title.narrative: TF Designations Assistance

description.narrative: Strengthen OAS Members capacity to implement domestic designations Covers grants (including revenue- sharing), subsidies, gratuities, and other aid for which cash payments are made to states, other political subdivisions, corporations, associations, and individuals; contributions to international societies, commissions, proceedings, or projects, whether in lump sum or as quotas of expenses; contributions fixed by treaty; grants to foreign countries; taxes imposed by taxing authorities where the Federal Government has consented to taxation (excluding the employers share of Federal Insurance Contribution Act taxes); and payments in lieu of taxes. Includes readjustment and other benefits for veterans, other than indemnities for death or disability.

title.narrative: Collaborative Investigation of Climate Change Solutions for Endangered Cultural Heritage in Trinidad and Tobago

description.narrative: In this project, the National Trust of Trinidad and Tobago is collaborating with the University of Florida's Historic Preservation Program on an initiative to advance the resilience and long-term preservation of the twin island nation's cultural heritage sites as they are increasingly impacted by a changing climate and rising seas. Support for this project comes from the AFCP 20th Anniversary Partnership Program, a State Department special initiative.
